course_title: Topics in Computer Science: Text Processing with Neural Networks
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 40 / Seats Avail: 27Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
Prerequisite: CS 253 and CS 325


Department permission required, please email bnflood@emory.edu.


This course offers an exploration into the fundamentals of text processing techniques and their integration with modern neural network architectures. Emphasis is placed on a range of neural networks from multilayer perceptrons to attention mechanisms and transformers. The goal is to empower participants to utilize these networks for cutting-edge text processing tasks.
course_description: May be repeated for credit when topic varies. Pre/co-requisites vary with topic.
schedule_location: MW 4pm-5:15pm in Math & Science Center - W201
